name: Bench Press (Barbell)
summary: Lie on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor.
Grasp the bar a little wider than shoulder width apart.
Lift the bar off the rack and hold it directly over your chest with arms extended.
Lower the bar slowly until it lightly touches your lower chest.
Press the bar back up until your arms are fully extended and elbows locked.
Return the bar to the rack carefully after your final rep.

name: Bench Press (Cable)
summary: Set a flat bench in the center of a cable machine with pulleys positioned low.
Lie on the bench and grab each handle with a neutral grip.
Start with your arms extended directly above your chest.
Lower the handles slowly until your elbows are at about a 90-degree angle.
Press the handles back up to the starting position, squeezing your chest.
Control the movement and repeat for your desired number of reps.

name: Bench Press (Dumbbell)
summary: Sit on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand resting on your thighs.
Lie back and bring the dumbbells to your chest level with palms facing forward.
Press the dumbbells up until your arms are fully extended above your chest.
Lower the dumbbells slowly until your elbows are at a 90-degree angle.
Press the weights back up while squeezing your chest muscles.
Lower the dumbbells carefully after your final rep and sit up.

name: Bench Press (Smith Machine)
summary: Position a flat bench under the Smith machine bar and lie down with the bar over your chest.
Grasp the bar slightly wider than shoulder width.
Unrack the bar by rotating your wrists and lowering it slowly to your chest.
Pause briefly when the bar touches your chest.
Press the bar back up until your arms are fully extended.
Rotate the bar to lock it back into the Smith machine after your final rep.

name: Bench Press - Wide Grip (Barbell)
summary: Lie on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor.
Grasp the bar with a wider-than-usual grip, several inches outside shoulder width.
Unrack the bar and hold it directly above your chest with arms extended.
Lower the bar slowly to your chest, keeping control throughout the movement.
Press the bar back up until your arms are fully extended and elbows locked.
Carefully rack the bar after your final rep.

name: Chest Dip
summary: Grasp the dip bars and lift your body with arms fully extended.
Lean your torso slightly forward to target the chest.
Lower your body slowly by bending your elbows until your upper arms are about parallel to the floor.
Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement.
Press back up by straightening your arms and maintaining the forward lean.
Repeat while maintaining control and proper form.

name: Chest Fly (Machine)
summary: Sit on the machine with your back flat against the pad and feet on the floor.
Grasp the handles with arms slightly bent and palms facing forward.
Bring the handles together in a wide arc until they meet in front of your chest.
Squeeze your chest at the peak of the movement.
Slowly return the handles to the starting position with control.
Repeat for your desired number of reps.

name: Chest Fly (Cable)
summary: Set the pulleys to chest height and grab a handle in each hand.
Stand in the center with one foot slightly forward for balance.
Extend your arms out to the sides with a slight bend in the elbows.
Bring the handles together in front of your chest in a wide arc.
Squeeze your chest at the peak, then slowly return to the starting position.
Keep your core tight and repeat for reps with controlled motion.

name: Chest Fly (Dumbbell)
summary: Lie on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other.
Extend your arms above your chest with a slight bend in the elbows.
Lower the dumbbells out to the sides in a wide arc until your chest feels a stretch.
Keep the bend in your elbows consistent throughout the movement.
Bring the dumbbells back up over your chest in the same arc.
Squeeze your chest at the top and repeat.

name: Chest Press (Machine)
summary: Sit on the machine with your back flat against the pad and feet flat on the floor.
Grasp the handles with your elbows bent at about 90 degrees.
Press the handles forward until your arms are fully extended.
Squeeze your chest at the end of the movement.
Slowly return the handles to the starting position.
Repeat with controlled reps, keeping your form tight.

name: Decline Bench Press (Barbell)
summary: Lie on a decline bench with your feet secured under the pads.
Grasp the bar slightly wider than shoulder width.
Unrack the bar and hold it directly over your lower chest with arms extended.
Lower the bar slowly until it lightly touches your lower chest.
Press the bar back up until your arms are fully extended and elbows locked.
Carefully rack the bar after your final rep.

name: Decline Bench Press (Dumbbell)
summary: Lie on a decline bench with your feet secured and a dumbbell in each hand.
Bring the dumbbells to chest level with palms facing forward.
Press the dumbbells up until your arms are fully extended above your lower chest.
Lower the dumbbells slowly in a controlled motion.
Stop when your elbows are at about a 90-degree angle.
Press the dumbbells back up and repeat.

name: Decline Bench Press (Smith Machine)
summary: Position a decline bench under the Smith machine and secure your feet.
Grasp the bar slightly wider than shoulder width.
Unrack the bar by rotating your wrists and hold it over your lower chest.
Lower the bar slowly until it touches your lower chest.
Press the bar back up until your arms are fully extended.
Rotate the bar to lock it in place after your final rep.

name: Incline Bench Press (Barbell)
summary: Sit on an incline bench with your feet flat on the floor.
Grasp the bar slightly wider than shoulder width apart.
Unrack the bar and hold it directly above your upper chest with arms extended.
Lower the bar slowly until it lightly touches your upper chest.
Press the bar back up until your arms are fully extended and elbows locked.
Carefully return the bar to the rack after your final rep.

name: Incline Bench Press (Cable)
summary: Set an incline bench in the center of a cable machine with pulleys set low.
Sit on the bench and grab a handle in each hand with palms facing forward.
Start with your hands at chest level and elbows bent.
Press the handles upward and slightly inward until your arms are fully extended.
Squeeze your chest at the top of the movement.
Lower the handles slowly back to the starting position and repeat.

name: Incline Bench Press (Dumbbell)
summary: Sit on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand resting on your thighs.
Lie back and bring the dumbbells to chest level with palms facing forward.
Press the dumbbells up until your arms are fully extended above your chest.
Lower the dumbbells slowly until your elbows are at about a 90-degree angle.
Keep your wrists straight and core engaged throughout the movement.
Press the dumbbells back up and repeat.

name: Incline Bench Press (Smith Machine)
summary: Set an incline bench under the Smith machine and adjust it so the bar is in line with your upper chest.
Grasp the bar slightly wider than shoulder width.
Unrack the bar by rotating your wrists and hold it above your chest.
Lower the bar slowly until it lightly touches your upper chest.
Press the bar back up until your arms are fully extended.
Rotate the bar to lock it back in place after your final rep.

name: Incline Chest Fly (Dumbbell)
summary: Sit on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand and lie back.
Extend your arms above your chest with a slight bend in the elbows and palms facing each other.
Lower the dumbbells out to the sides in a wide arc until you feel a stretch in your chest.
Keep the same bend in your elbows throughout the movement.
Bring the dumbbells back together over your chest in the same arc.
Squeeze your chest at the top and repeat.

name: Incline Chest Press (Machine)
summary: Sit on the incline chest press machine with your back flat against the pad.
Grasp the handles with your elbows bent and aligned with your upper chest.
Press the handles forward and upward until your arms are fully extended.
Squeeze your chest muscles at the top of the movement.
Slowly return to the starting position with control.
Repeat for your desired number of reps.

name: Push-Up
summary: Start in a plank position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder width.
Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
Lower your body by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the floor.
Press through your palms to return to the starting position.
Keep your core tight and elbows slightly tucked.
Repeat for your desired number of reps.

name: Push-Up
summary: Start in a plank position with a weight plate or vest secured on your back.
Keep your hands slightly wider than shoulder width.
Lower your chest toward the floor by bending your elbows.
Maintain a straight line from head to heels throughout the movement.
Press through your palms to return to the starting position.
Repeat while keeping your core engaged and movement controlled.
